historical:
Prior Codifications

Legislative History of Laws

For legislative history of D.C. Law 6-83, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 7-301.

DC CODE § 7-304

Current through December 11, 2012

sections.text: Except as provided in subsection (b) of this section, any person who willfully violates this chapter or any rule or regulation issued pursuant to this chapter shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and, upon conviction, subject to a fine not exceeding $1,000.

Any person who willfully discloses, receives, uses, or permits the use of information in violation of § 7-302 shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and, upon conviction, subject to a fine not exceeding $5,000, imprisonment for not more than 90 days, or both.
Prosecution shall be in the Superior Court of the District of Columbia by information signed by the Corporation Counsel.

title.text: Human Health Care and Safety. (Refs & Annos)

chapter.text: Reports of Cancer and Malignant Neoplastic Diseases.
